data.expected: BT (Blue) x GT (Green) -> 1/4 BG (Blue), 1/4 BT (Blue), 1/4 GT (Green), 1/4 TT (Turquoise)
data.sampled:
(Blue x Green) x (3/4 Blue 1/4 Green) -> 1 Turquoise (1) Blue 1 Green
Example Solution:
The genotypic ratio of the F1 offspring is BB_bgGG_g. Thus, the first blue and green traits are dominant, but the blue-green traits can be recessive (or incomplete dominance, according to conventional genetic terminology), so the BB_bgGG_g traits are only 1/4 of BB, 1/2 of BG and 1/2 of GG (the green trait). So, the genotypic ratio is BB_BG___g. In other words, the first green traits are dominant and the first blue and green traits are co-dominant, so the blue-green trait is produced, and so that is 1/2 of the genotypic ratio of BB_BG.

Example solution:
GGB (green) and GG (green)
In this population, the frequency of the B allele in the parent generation is 3/4. In the offspring generation, the frequency of B appears as 1, G is 3/4 and the GG is 1/2.
The genotypical analysis can be done using the following equation:
B = (B/B) + (G/G)
G = (G/G)
GG = (G/G)
Based on the given frequency and genotypical analysis, one of the possible outcomes is GG x GG = GG. In this case, 'GG' and 'GG' would be the parents in the F1-generation.

Example Task:
White (2n) X White(2n+1) - 2n X 1/2 white - 1n X White^2 -> Incomplete Dominance
Example Solution:
White x White X White x White^2 = Incomplete Dominance
Example Task:
1 White x Grey X Red - Grey x White - Red x White -> No Inheritance
Example Solution:
1 Grey x White - Red x Grey = No Inheritance

Example Task:
Red x red - White x White -> no inheritance
Example solutions:
Red x White - white x white -> no inheritance
Red x white x white -> Incomplete Dominant
Red x white x white x white -> Red
Example Task:
Red X Grey X grey x Grey -> Inceldominant
Example solution:
Red x Grey X Grey x Grey -> Incomplete Dominant

Example Task:
Grey X White - grey x white - White x Grey - 2n X 1 white
Example solution:
Grey x White - Red Eye white (grey x white - blue eye white - white blue eye white - white grey eye white - grey white eye white * grey eye white is a good match for Grey Eye White)
Example Task:
White + White or white + black or brown -> White
Example solution:
White + Yellow Grey Eye White - White x Red Eye White
Example Task:
White + yellow + Yellow + yellow - Grey Eye White -> Grey Eye White
Example Solution:
White x White x White -> White 
Example Task:
Yellow + Yellow Eye White - Brown Eye White + Grey Eye White
